DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Agent Adverse Drug Experience Report Dispensing Bottle Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric identifier of the bottle that is used by the pharmacist to dispense the prescribed medication as part of an action plan for or guidelines of a clinical trial associated with an adverse event report, a written notification to the FDA that a subject has experienced an adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Agent Adverse Drug Experience Report Dispensing Bottle Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the identifying name or number of a bottle that is used by the pharmacist to dispense the prescribed medication as part of an action plan for or guidelines of a clinical trial associated with an adverse event report, a written notification to the FDA that a subject has experienced an adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: Adverse Drug Experience Report Dispensing Bottle Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: Written notification to the FDA that a subject in a study has experienced an adverse event.:A bottle that is used by the pharmacist to dispense the prescribed medication. It includes preparations for which a dropper accompanies the bottle.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Written notification to the FDA that a subject has experienced an adverse event.
A bottle that is used by the pharmacist to dispense the prescribed medication. It includes preparations for which a dropper accompanies the bottle.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number to identify the bottle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Bottle Numbers which correspond to the AE report

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
